RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Geologia pela Universidade de Braslia (1973), mestrado em Sensoriamento Remoto pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (1976) e doutorado em Geologia Geral e de Aplicao pela Universidade de So Paulo (1984). Iiniciou suas atividades profissionais ao mesmo tempo em que o Brasil comeou a receber as primeiras imagens de sensoriamento remoto orbital. Desde ento, tem se utilizado da tecnologia de sensoriamento remoto como ferramenta de auxlio pesquisa mineral e petrolfera, assim como em estudos na rea ambiental, sempre em cooperao com organizaes nacionais e estrangeiras.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Geologia from Universidade de Braslia (1973), master's at Geosciences from Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (1976) and ph.d. at Geologia Geral e de Aplicao from Universidade de So Paulo (1984). Has experience in Geosciences, focusing on Geology, acting on the following subjects: sensoriamento remoto, remote sensing, pesquisa petrolfera, pesquisa mineral and integrao de dados.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Iniciou suas atividades profissionais no Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE) praticamente mesma poca em que o Brasil comeou a receber as imagens do primeiro satlite de sensoriamento remoto de recursos naturais, o ERST-1, mais tarde denominado Landsat-1. Desde ento vem utilizando as tecnologias de Sensoriamento Remoto e Geoprocessamento em estudos geolgicos, especialmente como ferramenta de auxlio na explorao petrolfera, tanto em ambiente ?onshore? como ?offshore?. Bastante desenvolvido no exterior, esse tipo de estudo ainda carece de desenvolvimento no Brasil. Com imensas reas a explorar, especialmente na Amaznia, a efetiva utilizao dessa tecnologia em nosso pas requer abordagens especficas que levem em conta condies particulares de pas tropical, com densa cobertura vegetal e espesso manto de intemperismo. nesse contexto que seus estudos vm sendo desenvolvidos, como atestam seus trabalhos publicados em peridicos internacionais nvel A. Embora atue em um rgo de pesquisa tecnolgica, onde a formao de recursos no atividade fim, o pesquisador orienta ou co-orienta alunos de ps-graduao, colaborando com Universidades como UFRJ e UNICAMP. Alm disso, participa em bancas examinadoras de teses e ministra a disciplina ?Sensoriamento Remoto Aplicado aos Sistemas Petrolferos Onshore? no Programa de Ps-Graduao em Sistemas Petrolferos do UFRJ/Coppe. O pesquisador atua ainda como consultor ?ad-hoc? de agncias de fomento pesquisa (CNPq, CAPES e FAPESP) e de publicaes nacionais e estrangeiras, tendo emitido nos ltimos trs anos vinte e trs pareceres sobre projetos submetidos a essas agncias ou sobre artigos cientficos submetidos a peridicos como Revista Brasileira de Geocincias, International Journal of Remote Sensing, Canadian Journal of Remote Sensing, Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, etc. Como atividade administrativa principal, o pesquisador coordena o acordo entre o INPE e a Agncia Espaci

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings 2004 IEEE International
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: The IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The study discusses the use of RADARSAT-1 images to identify oil seepage in the Foz do Amazonas Basin, an oil and gas exploration frontier in the Brazilian Equatorial margin. An unsupervised semivariogram textural classifier algorithm was used to enhance areas of smooth texture and low radar backscatter, indicative of these targets. Complementary information related to cloud top temperature, wind velocity, and modelling for the tidal regime (all obtained as close as possible to the RADARSAT-1 images acquisition) was used to support image interpretation and to exclude false-targets. Together with previously discovered sub-commercial shallow water oil accumulations, the detection of seepage slicks an additional evidence of oil generation in the study area. Results also indicate that radar remote sensing can be used as a tool to reduce risks in the exploration of frontier areas like the Foz do Amazonas Basin.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evidncia de uma mega captura fluvial no Rio Negro (Amaznia) revelada em modelo de elevao digital da SRTM

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XII Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Few kilometers east of the city of Manaus, in the heart of Amaznia, the Rio Solimes and its main tributary, the Rio Negro, converge to form the Rio Amazonas, which is responsible for about 15% of allfreshwater discharge in the oceans. Not far from the confluence, is the Anavilhanas Archipelago on the Rio Negro, the largest group of freshwater islands in the world. Refuge of extremely diversified fauna and flora, the region constitutes the Anavilhanas Ecological Station. Analysis of elevation data produced by the Shuttle Radar Topographic Mission (SRTM) shows signs of a paleo-route of the Lower Rio Negro. Flowing southward, its confluence with the Rio Solimes appeared to be located where today is the mouth of the Rio Manacapuru, about 70km west of Manaus. The analysis of these evidences, combined with previous geological and geophysical information, suggests that the present course of the Rio Negro in the region of the Anavilhanas Archipelago results from a mega fluvial capture, caused by an active neo-tectonic regime prevailing in the region.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Use of ASTER short-wave infrared bands for the spectral discrimination of hydrothermally altered-materials: evaluation in a tropical savannah environment

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XII Segundo Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ASTER data were used to evaluate the spectral discrimination of hydrothermally altered materials. The study area (Serra do Mendes granitoid) is located in Central Brazil. The vegetation is characterized by the presence of tropical savannah (the Brazilian Cerrados). The Spectral Angle Mapper (SAM) technique was used to detect the presence of hydroxyl-bearing minerals (e.g. kaolinite and K-micas) in the alteration zone. Results showed that the mineral detection was restricted to a small number of pixels of exposed altered materials. The presence of a sparse grass cover in the alteration zone produced a slight increase in the SAM classification angles and the replacement of the 2200 nm hydroxyl absorption band by the lignin-cellulose spectral feature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Avaliao das imagens do sensor ASTER para discriminao espectral de variaes faciolgicas no granito Serra Branca, Gois

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XII Simpsio Brasileiro de Sensoriamento Remoto

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was to evaluate ASTER images for the discrimination of faciological variations in the Serra Branca granite massif in the Tin Province of the Gois, which comprises several granitoid bodies with metasomatically altered facies mineralized with cassiterite. Classification of the multispectral images using Spectral Angle Mapping (SAM) techniques enhanced previously mapped areas of biotite-granite and metassomatically altered materials. However, due to the presence of the vegetation cover, detection of diagnostic minerals (e.g., muscovite) based on hydroxil absorption features was restricted to a small number of pixels. Results showed that under the savanna tropical environment of the study area, ASTER data were more efficacious for the characterization of rock-soil-vegetation associations than for the discrimination of the spectrally diagnostic mineralogical assemblage derived from the metassomatic activity in the study area.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Use of Landsat-TM fraction images to quantify the optical and SAR data relationship for land cover discrimination in the Brazilian Amaznia

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: ISPRS MID-TERM SYMPOSIUM
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Thematic Processing, Modeling and Analysis of Remote Sensing Data
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: International Institute for Geoinformation Science and Earth Observation-ITC

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a comparison between L-band HH JERS-1 SAR and Landsat TM data for land cover assessment in an Amazonian test site. For this, a study area located in the south of Rond?onia State, western Brazilian Amazonia, was selected. The Landsat TM data acquired on August 1st 1997 were converted to vegetation, soil, and shade fraction images, using a Linear Spectral Mixing Model. These fraction images are produced to enhance different characteristics of land cover, expressed as different mixtures of a few number of image components. The JERS-1 data acquired on August 08th 1997 for this investigation were processed to standard level 2.1, i.e., 16 bits ground range, 3 looks and a pixel spacing of 12.5 m. To compare JERS-1 and TM fraction images, a regression analysis technique was used. The multiple regression analysis showed coefficient of determination (R2) of 0.86 between SAR and the fraction images. The visual inspection of JERS-1 SAR image showed the high contrast between forest (medium gray) and cleared areas. (dark gray). There is a direct relationship between SAR and shade fraction images and an inverse relationship between SAR and soil fraction images. Based on these relationships, it can be pointed out the utility of SAR data as an alternative data source for land cover classification in the Amazonian region.
